output.conclusion: By completing this course, you have gained advanced knowledge of database management principles and techniques, enabling you to design, implement, and manage complex database systems effectively.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Database Management! This course delves into advanced concepts and techniques for designing, implementing, and managing robust and scalable database systems. We will explore topics such as advanced SQL, NoSQL databases, database security, performance tuning, and data warehousing.

chapters.description: Explore advanced SQL features like window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), recursive queries, and stored procedures for complex data manipulation and analysis.
Learn techniques for optimizing SQL queries, including understanding query execution plans, using indexes effectively, and rewriting queries for better performance.
Dive into transaction management concepts such as ACID properties, isolation levels, concurrency control, and deadlock handling to ensure data integrity.
Introduction to NoSQL databases, including different types (key-value, document, column-family, graph), their characteristics, and use cases.
Hands-on experience with MongoDB, a popular document database, covering data modeling, querying, indexing, and aggregation.
Explore Cassandra, a distributed column-family database, focusing on data modeling, write/read operations, and scalability considerations.
Learn about database security threats and vulnerabilities, access control mechanisms, encryption techniques, and auditing practices.
Explore advanced performance tuning techniques, including identifying performance bottlenecks, optimizing database configuration, and using monitoring tools.
Introduction to data warehousing concepts, including ETL processes, data modeling for analytical purposes, and OLAP operations.
